Job Title: Field and Technical Support Specialist

Location: Mansfield, TX

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Management, Manufacturing

Description:
Klein Tools is a dynamic, fast-paced and results driven company dedicated to launching hundreds of innovative products each year. Are you ready to make an impact?

Perks for you include:

 Paid Vacations & Holidays Profit Sharing & Matching 401(k) Health Insurance (Medical, Vision, & Dental) Discounts on Klein Tools products Education and Professional Development Assistance

The Field and Technical Support Specialist is responsible for generating numerous opportunities per day to management, engineering and/or other Klein employees onto job sites to observe and/or receive feedback on current tool applications, new products being developed, potential opportunities for improvements or potential new ideas. This exposure to our core customer﴾s﴿ is critical in the new product development process at Klein Tools and will drive and prioritize the projects within the organization. The Field specialist is also expected to provide technical feedback to the Product team and to assist customer service in responding to customers questions.

Responsibilities

 Perform all field activities and requirements as they relate to the new product development and VOC research processes.  Provide product support and customer/consumer assistance via email, telephone, written or other methods of communication for Klein‐branded mechanical tools. Maintaining Zen Desk database with data entry regarding contact person, problem inquiry, resolution and any action steps taken.  Assist all departments as necessary with specific knowledge, industry insight and access to job sites for various needs ranging from tool use observation, photography and video of tools in use, product design, engineering and management learning as it relates to product development and competitive assessments.  Recruit new members to the Tradesman Club each week in order to build a more robust database for use in future testing, promotions, communications, etc.  Identify and develop new product ideas and convey them to the appropriate Product Manager each month. The ideas should be viable enough to merit further investigation and should lead to product improvements and/or new product ideas.  Communicate product quality issues to the corporate quality team.  Perform all other duties as required. 

Qualifications

Associate's degree and a minimum of three ﴾3﴿ years of technical support experience is required. Equivalent work experience or certified/trained electrician will be considered.

Must have strong verbal and written communication skills and the ability to handle all types of customer calls. Must have strong computer skills with Excel, email, and other online programs to capture data such as ZenDesk.

Physical Demands

Occasionally required to stand, walk or sit; use hands to finger, handle or feel objects, tools or controls; reach with hands and arms; climb stairs; balance; stoop, kneel, crouch or crawl; talk or hear; taste or smell. The employee must occasionally lift and/or move objects up to 25 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by the job include close vision, distance vision, color vision, peripheral vision, depth perception, and the ability to adjust focus.

Your main focus:

 Quality Customer Obsession Innovation Ownership Teamwork

Klein Tools is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or veteran status. For candidates with disabilities and needing assistance, please email us at hr@kleintools.com.

Apply Now

Experience Level (if available): Entry level
